abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Agricultural
            Services and Producer Organizations Project for Senegal were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was substantial; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: attempting a
            radical transformation of agricultural services with the
            attendant institutional reforms is risky, transaction
            intensive, requires adequate staff and budget, and requires
            long-term involvement by the World Bank. Within the
            framework of an agricultural services project, support to
            producer organizations is crucial. One key issue in
            agricultural services projects is the level of funding that
            beneficiaries should provide. Evaluating the effects of
            agricultural services projects is a complex and
            methodologically challenging task.
